text:
There are two parts to this session, a documentary element that lasts 35 minutes, followed by 20 minutes of immersive digital art.
The documentary element was excellent taking you through chapters of Klimt's life, really five-star, very well put together and presented l.
The immersive art experience should have been really good, but this is where my gripe lies and the reason it drops a star. I really think children under 15 years old shouldn't be allowed into this exhibition. When the immersive performance started, several children started shouting and running around, chasing the moving patterns on the floor. You can't expect the parents to stop this. It doesn't work. They just shouldn't allow young children in. It spoils the atmosphere for adults trying to enjoy the music & visual experience of the immersive show.
Absolutely amazing! Fantastic experience! I would be so thrilled if the whole event would come to the UK.  We did all 3 exhibitions in the one day as it was so good.
Very fun and interactive exhibition. Worth dropping by if you have time
Simply amazing. Really spent a great time watching the immersive exhibition. Thank you
Beautiful paintings. Nice arrangement of music and animation. Interesting life story, full of twists and turns. Love it.
